citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Several expired medications (cephalexin Exp 1/20, nemex Exp 9/22, chlorconazole ear flush Exp 9/22, trizedta ear flush
Exp 1/20, triple wormer Exp 7/22, derma-vet ointment Exp unreadable and two bottles of liquid melatonin Exp 6/20 and
6/21) were in storage. The licensee is unsure if any of the medications had been used since the expiration dates. Having
expired medications in storage increases the likelihood that they will be used on the animals. The use of expired
medications might not have the intended effect on the animals or could make them sick. Ensure expired medications are
not stored and used on the animals.

Six weaned puppies all under sixteen weeks of age do not have identification numbers listed on their cage card. Lack of
identification does not allow for the proper tracking of the puppies. All puppies must be identified with official USDA
identification. Correct by November 10, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Several expired medications (cephalexin Exp 1/20, nemex Exp 9/22, chlorconazole ear flush Exp 9/22, trizedta ear flush 
Exp 1/20, triple wormer Exp 7/22, derma-vet ointment Exp unreadable and two bottles of liquid melatonin Exp 6/20 and 
6/21) were in storage. The licensee is unsure if any of the medications had been used since the expiration dates. Having 
expired medications in storage increases the likelihood that they will be used on the animals. The use of expired 
medications might not have the intended effect on the animals or could make them sick. Ensure expired medications are 
not stored and used on the animals. 
2.50(a)(2) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
Six weaned puppies all under sixteen weeks of age do not have identification numbers listed on their cage card. Lack of 
identification does not allow for the proper tracking of the puppies. All puppies must be identified with official USDA 
identification. Correct by November 10, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
